content.question: Butler’s view of Sudeten German grievances most directly shows the effects of which of the following?

choices.label: The failure of the post–First World War peace settlement to meet its goals
The desire of many British politicians to militarily confront Germany
The belief among many Europeans that communism was a greater threat than fascism
The success of the Nazi German government in mitigating the effects of the Great Depression

content.answer: The failure of the post–First World War peace settlement to meet its goals

skill.text: Skill 5.B: Explain how a historical development or process relates to another historical development or process.
